Stage 3 _ Phase 4 _ Conditioning _ Rope Skipping _ Rope skipping is an excellent activity to build conditioning, footwork skills, co ordination, leg speed and power.& Players might need to be taught the basics, and once mastered, there are countless drills and exercises to do!
Basic: To find a rope that fits, place one foot in the center of the rope and lift the handles - they shouldn't go past your armpits. Jump 1 to 2 inches off floor, giving rope just enough space to slip under your feet. Only the balls of feet should touch the floor. Keep elbows close to sides as you turn the rope.& The movement comes from the wrists and forearms, not the shoulders. Aim: One jump per loop, single step.

Stage 3 _ Phase 4 _ Conditioning _ Repeat Run-a-3s _ A bit like suicide runs, but cricket-specific. Players run 3 runs the length of a cricket pitch.& Their aim is to run as fast as they can, focusing on good turn mechanics.& This is a repeat effort exercise of maximal intensity.
GIve players a target time in which to run the 3 runs in.& For example, under 15 seconds.
Provide them with a period of rest to partially recover, but not completely, (no more than 30 seconds.) Indicate the number of repetitions to complete. 6 reps of 3-Run-A-3's sub 15 seconds on a 30 second cycle.

Stage 3 _ Phase 4 _ Conditioning _ Dragonfly Running _ 5 Players form a group The drill is similar to Indian File Running, Except that the runner weaves though each player in the line.& THe drill incorporates the varied speed component, as well as ducking and weaving drills
You can make this a competitive exercise and increase the intensity by racing terms against each other
Begin with 1 lap of the field. Build to 4 laps

Stage 3 _ Phase 4 _ Conditioning _ Indian Running File _ 5 Players form a group.& The group starts by running in a straight, single file line around the perimeter of the field.& The runner at the back of the line runs to the outside to sprint forward to a position in front of the original leader and becomes the new leader.& He/she slows to the pace of the group.& Then, the new person in the back of the line sprints forward and becomes the new leader and slows down to the pace of the group.& The process repeats and becomes a cycle.& You can make this a competitive exercise and increases the intensity by racing teams against each other.& Begin with 1 lap of the field.& Build to 4.

Stage 3 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Health & Upper Body Strength _ Standard throwing warm up _ Players to pair up with a cricket ball between them and a baseball mitt each.& Wicketkeeper to use catching gloves.& each player to complete following number throws at set distances with suggested intensity
1) 1 set of 10 flat throws at 70-75% intensity over 15-20m 2) 1 set of 10 flat throws at 90% intensity over 25-30m 3) 1 set of 10 flat throws at 90% intensity over 35-40m

Stage 3 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Health & Upper Body Strength _ Push-Ups _ Complete as many sets as required to complete a total of 20 push-ups with good form.& Aim is to complete 20 good form push-ups consecutively

Stage 3 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Health & Upper Body Strength _ Supermans _ In plank position, simultaneously extend left arm and right leg.& Hold for 3 seconds.& Return to centre and repeat the action with right arm and left leg

Stage 3 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Health & Upper Body Strength _ Open Arms _ Stand tall, feet parallel and shoulder width apart.& With arms at 60 degree abduction and palms facing forward, squeeze arms behind the line of the body to open the chest & shoulders.& Bring back to the midline and lift to 90 degree abduction and repeat the action.& Bring back to the midline and lift to 120 degree abduction and repeat the action.& Increase range and movement speed, and vary arm position - i.e right arm at 120 degree with left arm at 60 degree abduction.

Stage 3 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Health & Upper Body Strength _ Arm Circles : Small-Big-Small _ Stand tall, feet parallel and shoulder width apart.& Extend arms out to the side, shoulder height.& Make small circular movements with the arms, initiating the action from the shoulder joint.& Complete in a forwards motion, followed by a backwards motion.& Increase range and movement speed whilst maintaining stability and stillness through trunk and hips.

Stage 3 _ Phase 2 _ Locomotion _ 10 - 0 - 5 Turn Speed _ This drill requires players to work their turn speed in relation to correct wicket-running mechanics.& From athletic ""power"" stance position, players to sprint forward to the 10m line and turn rapidly to return 5m.

Stage 3 _ Phase 2 _ Locomotion _ Fly In + Outs (Accelerate 10 - Top Speed 10 - Ease off 10) _ The aim of this drill is to move in and out of top speed sprinting.&
Accelerate from 0-10m. From 10-20m players should be at top sprint speed.& From 20-30m, players relax and ease off

Stage 3 _ Phase 2 _ Locomotion _ Falling Acceleration Starts _ From athletic "power" stance position, on cue, players to lean and "fall" forward as far as possible.& As soon as they feel as if they are going to fall, facilitate a good knee drive in front to explode towards the 20 metre marker
Complete 3 run-throughs, increasing pace with each effort.&
As a variation, stand at the 10 Metre mark with a tennis ball in hand and arm extended at shoulder level held out to the side.& Drops the ball - the aim is for the player to catch the ball before it bounces
Stage 3 _ Phase 2 _ Locomotion _ Easy Run Through _ At around 3/4 pace, players must run from start line to 30 M mark

Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Hop and Hold _ For this drill, players to hop and hold on the same leg.& Ask them to focus on increasing their hopping distance so that the demands on their landing skills are increased, as well as targeting single leg strength and power components

Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Lateral Leap And Hold _ This is essentially the same drill as the leap and hold.& This time leaping in a lateral direction.& Suggest to the players to visualise they are leaping from one side of a lane on an athletics track to the other side.

Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Fast Switch Reaction Cues _ Players to raise one leg to a locked horizontal position with hip held high.& On cue of "switch", players to with legs rapidly as possible and hold.& The aim is to maintain stillness of head and trunk, whilst arms and legs change positions with rhythmic speed and a piston-like action
Change the cue from "Switch" to a number (e.g. 1,2,3,4) to indicate the number of times arms and legs to change position.& Call the numbers randomly.

Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Stork Tip _ High step to plant foot and tip forward to touch the ground close to toes.& Aim to hold the leg straight to encourage length through the hamstrings

Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Arabesque Balance _ High step to plant foot and tip forward into an arabesque balance, maintaining strong streamlined position from crown of head through to extended leg behind.& Hold 3 Seconds.& Aim to hold standing leg straight to encourage length through hamstrings

Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Travelling sumo squats and side bend _ The squat action is the same.& The addition is the side bend at the bottom.&
At the bottom of the squat, raise arm of trailing leg and stretch over top of head into a lateral stretch.& Return to centre with trunk upright and chest open.
Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Lunge + Extend + Rotate

Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Travelling Sumo Squats _ Take a side-step so that feet are placed wider than shoulder width apart, weight equally distributed from left to right from heels to balls of feet.& Initiate a squat movement simultaneously flexing hips, knees and ankles.& Keep your weight centred, knees taking over toes and soles of feet in contact with the ground.& Descent to a thighs parallel position and pause for 1 Second. (Heels must stay on the ground.) As you lift out of the squat, word for the ground up to push "through" the floor into full standing position.& Pivot on lead leg to face the opposite direction and repeat.

Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Lunge + "Point The Gun" _ The lunge action is the same, this time arms are extended in front of the chest with palms pressed together.& As you descended into lunge, rotate torso to the same side as the bent knee, aiming to twist as far as possible with arms straight and head in line with torso.

Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Lunge and Streamlined Arms _ Lift right knee high to take an exaggerated step forward and plant the right foot onto the ground pointing directly ahead.& Descend into a lunge position by flexing right hip, knee and ankle.& Front thigh should reach parallel position to the floor.& At the same time, extend the left led behind so that there is equal weight distribution to bring strength and stability to the posture.& Reach both arms overhead into a streamlined position to open chest , torso, and front of hips.& Face palms forward and squeeze biceps behind ears.& Stay strong through the core as you come out of the lunge to lift left knee high and through to change sides
Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Calf Pumps
Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Downward Dog - Plank (10s) - Lower (5s Count) - Upward Dog
Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Downward facing dog + upward facing dog
Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Crucifix Cross-Overs Prone
Stage 3 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Crucifix Cross Overs Supine

Stage 2 _ Phase 4 _ Conditioning Activity _ Skipping rope _ Rope skipping is an excellent activity to build conditioning, footwork skills, co ordination, leg speed and power.& Players might need to be taught the basics, and once mastered, there are countless drills and exercises to do!
Basic: To find a rope that fits, place one foot in the center of the rope and lift the handles - they shouldn't go past your armpits.& Jump 1 to 2 inches off floor, giving rope just enough space to slip under your feet. Only the balls of feet should touch the floor.& Keep elbows close to sides as you turn the rope. The movement comes from the wrists and forearms, not the shoulders.& Aim: One jump per loop, single step.

Stage 2 _ Phase 4 _ Conditioning Activity _ Repeat run a 3s _ A bit like suicide runs, but cricket-specific.& Players run 3 runs the length of a cricket pitch.& Their aim is to run as fast as they can, focusing on good turn mechanics.& This is a repeat effort exercise of maximal intensity.& GIve players a target time in which to run the 3 runs in. For example, under 15 seconds.&
Provide them with a period of rest to partially recover, but not completely, (no more than 30 seconds.) Indicate the number of repetitions to complete.& 6 reps of 3-Run-A-3's sub 15 seconds on a 30 second cycle.

Stage 2 _ Phase 4 _ Conditioning Activity _ Dragonfly Running _ 5 Players form a group The drill is similar to Indian File Running, Except that the runner weaves though each player in the line.& THe drill incorporates the varied speed component, as well as ducking and weaving drills
You can make this a competitive exercise and increase the intensity by racing terms against each other
Begin with 1 lap of the field.& Build to 4 laps

Stage 2 _ Phase 4 _ Conditioning Activity _ Indian Running File _ 5 Players form a group.& The group starts by running in a straight, single file line around the perimeter of the field.& The runner at the back of the line runs to the outside to sprint forward to a position in front of the original leader and becomes the new leader.& He/she slows to the pace of the group.& Then, the new person in the back of the line sprints forward and becomes the new leader and slows down to the pace of the group.& The process repeats and becomes a cycle.& You can make this a competitive exercise and increases the intensity by racing teams against each other.& Begin with 1 lap of the field.& Build to 4.

Stage 2 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Prep & Throwing Warm-Up _ Standard throwing warm up _ Players to pair up with a cricket ball between them and a baseball mitt each. Wicketkeeper to use catching gloves. each player to complete following number throws at set distances with suggested intensity
1) 1 set of 10 flat throws at 70-75% intensity over 15-20m 2) 1 set of 10 flat throws at 90% intensity over 25-30m 3) 1 set of 10 flat throws at 90% intensity over 35-40m

Stage 2 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Prep & Throwing Warm-Up _ Push-Ups _ Complete as many sets as required to complete a total of 20 push-ups with good form.& Aim is to complete 20 good form push-ups consecutively

Stage 2 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Prep & Throwing Warm-Up _ Supermans _ In plank position, simultaneously extend left arm and right leg.& Hold for 3 seconds.& Return to centre and repeat the action with right arm and left leg

Stage 2 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Prep & Throwing Warm-Up _ Open Arms _ Stand tall, feet parallel and shoulder width apart.& With arms at 60 degree abduction and palms facing forward, squeeze arms behind the line of the body to open the chest & shoulders.& Bring back to the midline and lift to 90 degree abduction and repeat the action.& Bring back to the midline and lift to 120 degree abduction and repeat the action.& Increase range and movement speed, and vary arm position - i.e right arm at 120 degree with left arm at 60 degree abduction.

Stage 2 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Prep & Throwing Warm-Up _ Arm Circles : Small-Big-Small _ Stand tall, feet parallel and shoulder width apart.& Extend arms out to the side, shoulder height.& Make small circular movements with the arms, initiating the action from the shoulder joint.& Complete in a forwards motion, followed by a backwards motion.& Increase range and movement speed whilst maintaining stability and stillness through trunk and hips.

Stage 2 _ Phase 2 _ Fielding-Based Activity & Acceleration & Turn Speed _ 10 - 0 - 5 Turn Speed :: Right-Side Turn / Left-Side Turn _ This drill requires players to work their turn speed in relation to correct wicket-running mechanics.& From athletic "power" stance position, players to sprint forward to the 10m line and turn rapidly to return 5m.

Stage 2 _ Phase 2 _ Fielding-Based Activity & Acceleration & Turn Speed _ Falling Acceleration Starts _ From athletic "power" stance position, on cue, players to lean and "fall" forward as far as possible.& As soon as they feel as if they are going to fall, facilitate a good knee drive in front to explode towards the 20 metre marker
Complete 3 run-throughs, increasing pace with each effort.
As a variation, stand at the 10 Metre mark with a tennis ball in hand and arm extended at shoulder level held out to the side. Drops the ball - the aim is for the player to catch the ball before it bounces

Stage 2 _ Phase 2 _ Fielding-Based Activity & Acceleration & Turn Speed _ Catch + Running Lane Drill _ Position a pair of cones approximately 15-20 metres apart.& Divide the group into two groups, asking each group to line up behind each cone to face each other.& The first player in each line start running towards each other.& Player 1 underarm throws a cricket ball to player 2; upon releasing the ball, he/she continues running to form the end of the line on the opposition group to where he/she started.& Player 2, who has taken the catch with two hands continues to process by underarm throwing to player 3_ and so on.& Once each player has been through a couple of rounds of easy pass and catching, add the following variation 1 Ground balls 2 Half volleys 3 High catches - take the catch with both feet in the air Upon a player releasing the ball, add the following running variations: 1 Side steps to the end of the line 2 Carioca to the end of the line 3 Sprint to the end of the line To finish the drill give a 60 second warning, challenging the group to complete as many "touches as possible and no mistakes

Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Arabesque Balance _ High step to plant foot and tip forward into an arabesque balance, maintaining strong streamlined position from crown of head through to extended leg behind.& Hold 3 Seconds.& Aim to hold standing leg straight to encourage length through hamstrings

Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Hop + Hold _ For this drill, players to hop and hold on the same leg.& Ask them to focus on increasing their hopping distance so that the demands on their landing skills are increased, as well as targeting single leg strength and power components

Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Lateral Leap + Hold _ This is essentially the same drill as the leap and hold.& This time leaping in a lateral direction.& Suggest to the players to visualise they are leaping from one side of a lane on an athletics track to the other side.

Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Leap + Hold _ Players to leap forward a comfortable distance, landing on opposite leg to take off leg.& Players should aim to absorb the impact of landing by flexing ankles, knees and hips.& The landing should be "held" for 3 seconds, before embarking on subsequent hop. (arms can be used to assist in hopping and landing mechanics.)

Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Fast Switch Reaction Cues _ Players to raise one leg to a locked horizontal position with hip held high.& On cue of "switch", players to with legs rapidly as possible and hold.& The aim is to maintain stillness of head and trunk, whilst arms and legs change positions with rhythmic speed and a piston-like action.& Change the cue from "Switch" to a number (e.g. 1,2,3,4) to indicate the number of times arms and legs to change position. Call the numbers randomly.

Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Traveling Sumo Squats _ Take a side-step so that feet are placed wider than shoulder width apart, weight equally distributed from left to right from heels to balls of feet.& Initiate a squat movement simultaneously flexing hips, knees and ankles.& Keep your weight centred, knees taking over toes and soles of feet in contact with the ground.& Descent to a thighs parallel position and pause for 1 Second. (Heels must stay on the ground.) As you lift out of the squat, word for the ground up to push "through" the floor into full standing position.& Pivot on lead leg to face the opposite direction and repeat.

Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Lunge + "Point The Gun" _ The lunge action is the same, this time arms are extended in front of the chest with palms pressed together.& As you descended into lunge, rotate torso to the same side as the bent knee, aiming to twist as far as possible with arms straight and head in line with torso.

Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Lunge + Streamlined Arms _ Lift right knee high to take an exaggerated step forward and plant the right foot onto the ground pointing directly ahead.& Descend into a lunge position by flexing right hip, knee and ankle.& Front thigh should reach parallel position to the floor.& At the same time, extend the left led behind so that there is equal weight distribution to bring strength and stability to the posture.& Reach both arms overhead into a streamlined position to open chest , torso, and front of hips.& Face palms forward and squeeze biceps behind ears.& Stay strong through the core as you come out of the lunge to lift left knee high and through to change sides
Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Calf Pumps
Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Downward Dog - Plank (10s) - Lower (5s Count) - Upward Dog
Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Downward Facing Dog - Upward Facing Dog
Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Leg Swings Side to Side
Stage 2 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Leg Swings Forwards + Backwards

Stage 1 _ Phase 4 _ Conditioning Activity _ Rope Skipping _ Rope skipping is an excellent activity to build conditioning, footwork skills, co ordination, leg speed and power.& Players might need to be taught the basics, and once mastered, there are countless drills and exercises to do!
Basic: To find a rope that fits, place one foot in the center of the rope and lift the handles - they shouldn't go past your armpits.& Jump 1 to 2 inches off floor, giving rope just enough space to slip under your feet. Only the balls of feet should touch the floor.& Keep elbows close to sides as you turn the rope.& The movement comes from the wrists and forearms, not the shoulders.& Aim: One jump per loop, single step.

GIve players a target time in which to run the 3 runs in.& For example, under 15 seconds.&
Provide them with a period of rest to partially recover, but not completely, (no more than 30 seconds.) Indicate the number of repetitions to complete.& 6 reps of 3-Run-A-3's sub 15 seconds on a 30 second cycle.

Stage 1 _ Phase 4 _ Conditioning Activity _ Dragonfly Run _ 5 Players form a group The drill is similar to Indian File Running, Except that the runner weaves though each player in the line.& THe drill incorporates the varied speed component, as well as ducking and weaving drills You can make this a competitive exercise and increase the intensity by racing terms against each other Begin with 1 lap of the field.& Build to 4 laps

Stage 1 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Health & Upper Body Strength _ Supermans _ In plank position, simultaneously extend left arm and right leg.& Hold for 3 seconds.& Return to centre and repeat the action with right arm and left leg

Stage 1 _ Phase 3 _ Shoulder Health & Upper Body Strength _ Open Arms _ Stand tall, feet parallel and shoulder width apart.& With arms at 60 degree abduction and palms facing forward, squeeze arms behind the line of the body to open the chest & shoulders.& Bring back to the midline and lift to 90 degree abduction and repeat the action.& Bring back to the midline and lift to 120 degree abduction and repeat the action.& Increase range and movement speed, and vary arm position - i.e right arm at 120 degree with left arm at 60 degree abduction.

Stage 1 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Downward Facing Dog - Upward Facing Dog
Stage 1 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Leg Swings Side to Side
Stage 1 _ Phase 1 _ Dynamic Flex & Strength & Hop + Holds _ Leg Swings Forwards + Backwards
